intro: Commersonia rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leafed commersonia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are often visited by insects, contributing to its role in local ecosystems. Commersonia rotundifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
